prompt: <description>**Intermediate CAD Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat base and a flat top. The cylindrical hole is centered within the prism and is of equal height to the prism itself. The prism is symmetrical along its central axis. Start by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, we will have two faces: - Face 1: Begin by creating loop 1: line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.25] arc 1: Start Point [0.375, 0.25], Mid Point [0.1875, 0.4375], End Point [0.0, 0.25] line 3: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Then, create loop 2 by drawing circle 1 with its center at [0.1875, 0.25] and Radius 0.125. Create the 3D Sketch: Set the scaling parameter to 0.4375 and transform the 2D sketch. The euler angles are in degrees and translation vector is the translation of the 2D sketch plane. Extrude the sketch into a 3D model: Use an extrusion depth of 0.75 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. This will create a solid body with the specified shape. **Intermediate CAD Part 2** Create a structure resembling a 3D grid, composed of four cylinders and rectangular plates. The cylinders have a flat top and bottom and are arranged in a square pattern with a diagonal offset. The cylinders have varying heights, with the tallest in the top left corner and the shortest in the bottom right corner. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: Set Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector to [0.0463, 0.0, 0.0463]. For the sketch, there will be 4 faces: - Face 1, Face 2, Face 3, Face 4: For each face, create a loop with a single circle: circle_1: Center [0.0162, 0.0162/0.6412], Radius 0.0162. Each circle corresponds to the base of one cylinder. Create the 3D Sketch: Set the scaling parameter to 0.6575 and transform the 2D sketch. Extrude the sketch into a 3D model: Use an extrusion depth of 0.0 towards the normal and 0.125 in the opposite direction of the normal. This will create a solid body with the specified shape.</description>
